discussion.content: "A guest OS" implies that it is a VM so a snapshot versus a database backup makes more sense. There is nothing in the question related to SQL or any other database.

Selected Answer: AD
nothing in the scenario re database, but surely mentions 'guest OS'

It mentions last avail backup was 12 months ago, didn't say what type of backup, which makes A Full Backup first choice before patching, B - doesn't apply, C - doesn't apply if doing full backup from 12 months ago, E - doesn't apply, D Virtual machine snapshot - applies as only thing that makes sense from the other choices
A and D (Snapshot) back up should be the correct answer.

questions.question_text:
The last available backup is from 12 months ago. Which of the following should an administrator perform prior to applying a critical application patch to a guest
OS? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When a RAID array is in use, the LED light on the hard drive often indicates the health of the disk or the RAID array. A red LED typically means there is an issue, such as a failing disk or a degraded RAID array. To verify the RAID functionality, the technician needs to access the server's RAID controller or management interface to check the status of the RAID array and identify any issues (such as a failed disk or degraded state).

Network-based hardware administration allows the technician to remotely access the RAID controller or hardware management interface through a network (e.g., using tools like Dell iDRAC, HP iLO, or other remote management platforms). This will give the technician insight into the RAID configuration, status, and alerts that can help diagnose the issue.

comments.content: B & D are out because of relevance leaving A or C. A is out because we already know the drive is bad due to the red light. This is not the technical reason why but through process of elimination like many other answers.

discussion.content: Any explanation why correct answer is C?

questions.question_text: A remote technician is notified that a LED light for a server's hard drive is red. Which of the following should the technician check to verify RAID functionality?

A datacenter systems administrator needs to install a new server within an existing rack. Which of the following components would the systems administrator need to physically install the server in the rack? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: There is not enough information in the question to indicate that fiber cables are necessary. The only thing that makes sense is rails and cable management. I assume they mean the little arm that is often included with rack mount servers. The other items should already be in place, and fiber cables would be making a huge leap in assumptions that shouldn't be necessary in a test question.

Selected Answer: AB
Fiber cables are typically used for network connections or data transmission but are not required for physically installing the server into the rack. These cables are for network connectivity, which comes after installation.

BUT since R6 is parity so it does provide better redundancy.

choices.A: configure using four disks in a RAID 0 array
choices.B: configure using four disks in a RAID 5 array
